prompt: What accessibility issues exist in the product-thumbnail.liquid snippet? What specific changes would improve it?
responseText:
Accessibility issues in product-thumbnail.liquid:

1. Interactive div without keyboard semantics — <div data-t4s-gallery--open> is clickable but uses a div, not a button. No role="button", tabindex="0", or keyboard event handlers.

2. Alt text can silently become empty — The complex t4option/underscore parsing logic can produce blank img_alt. No final fallback to product.title.

3. Hidden variant media lacks aria-hidden — isMediaHidden adds a CSS class but screen readers still traverse hidden content.

4. No focus indicators — No :focus-visible styles on gallery-open element.

5. Video/model media has no accessible label — Deferred media template renders with no aria-label indicating media type.

6. Noscript images duplicate content — Both lazy-loaded img and noscript fallback exist in DOM.

7. No prefers-reduced-motion check — t4s-lz--fadeIn animation plays regardless of user motion preferences.

8. Placeholder data:image/gif announced as image — Base64 placeholder GIF has real alt text before actual image loads.
notes: Cursor agent (Claude 4.6 Opus) with direct file access. 2 file reads, analysis produced in single pass.
